inventory.name: Chain Mail
inventory.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows.

inventory.name: Longsword
inventory.description: A versatile weapon that can be used with one or two hands.

inventory.name: Shield
inventory.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand.

objects.name: Old Barrel
objects.description: A weathered wooden barrel that has seen better days.

properties.true_description: A weathered wooden barrel that has been cleverly modified with a false bottom. Faint scratches around the rim suggest it has been opened frequently.
properties.true_examination_text: The barrel's bottom sounds hollow when tapped, and there are tool marks around the rim indicating it has been modified for concealment.

mythic_events.name: The Oath of Twelve
mythic_events.description: Twelve leaders swore an oath at the mountain pass, creating an order that endures in legend.

artifact_lore.name: Gauntlets of the Twelve Oaths
artifact_lore.creation_story: When the Twelve swore their legendary oath at the mountain pass, each pressed their hand into molten steel. These gauntlets bear the handprints of those ancient heroes.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of honor, duty, and brotherhood. Many knightly orders trace their traditions back to the Oath of Twelve.
legendary_properties: +2 to Strength-based attack and damage rolls
Unarmed strikes deal 1d8 + Strength modifier damage
Once per day, can call upon oath to gain advantage on all attacks for 1 minute
Cannot be disarmed while wearing these gauntlets
artifact_lore.location_hint: Buried with one of the Twelve in a hidden tomb at the mountain pass

mythic_events.name: The First Flame
mythic_events.description: A small group learned to tame fire and passed that secret to their kin.

artifact_lore.name: Crown of the First Flame
artifact_lore.creation_story: Crafted when humanity first learned to control fire, this crown holds the eternal spark of that first flame. Its creators inscribed it with the secret names of heat and light.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Represents the dawn of civilization and mastery over nature. Worn by fire-priests and revolutionary leaders throughout history.
legendary_properties: Grants immunity to fire damage
Wearer can cast Fireball (3rd level) once per day
Provides bright light in 20-foot radius, dim light 20 feet beyond
Bearer has advantage on Intimidation checks
artifact_lore.location_hint: Hidden in a sacred shrine where the First Flame was discovered

mythic_events.name: The Oath of Twelve
mythic_events.description: Twelve leaders swore an oath at the mountain pass, creating an order that endures in legend.

artifact_lore.name: Gauntlets of the Twelve Oaths
artifact_lore.creation_story: When the Twelve swore their legendary oath at the mountain pass, each pressed their hand into molten steel. These gauntlets bear the handprints of those ancient heroes.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of honor, duty, and brotherhood. Many knightly orders trace their traditions back to the Oath of Twelve.
legendary_properties: +2 to Strength-based attack and damage rolls
Unarmed strikes deal 1d8 + Strength modifier damage
Once per day, can call upon oath to gain advantage on all attacks for 1 minute
Cannot be disarmed while wearing these gauntlets
artifact_lore.location_hint: Buried with one of the Twelve in a hidden tomb at the mountain pass

mythic_events.name: The Quiet Plague
mythic_events.description: A sickness passed through generations and reshaped population centers.

artifact_lore.name: Chalice of the Quiet Plague
artifact_lore.creation_story: Fashioned by healers during the Quiet Plague in a desperate attempt to understand the sickness. Those who drank from it could sense disease, though many died in the attempt.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A grim reminder of past suffering, but also of the courage of healers. Medical traditions still reference the sacrifices made during the plague.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Detect Poison and Disease at will
Advantage on Medicine checks
Once per day, can remove one disease from a touched creature
Immune to disease (but can still carry and transmit)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Sealed in a quarantine vault in the ruins of a plague hospital

mythic_events.name: The Quiet Plague
mythic_events.description: A sickness passed through generations and reshaped population centers.

artifact_lore.name: Chalice of the Quiet Plague
artifact_lore.creation_story: Fashioned by healers during the Quiet Plague in a desperate attempt to understand the sickness. Those who drank from it could sense disease, though many died in the attempt.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A grim reminder of past suffering, but also of the courage of healers. Medical traditions still reference the sacrifices made during the plague.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Detect Poison and Disease at will
Advantage on Medicine checks
Once per day, can remove one disease from a touched creature
Immune to disease (but can still carry and transmit)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Sealed in a quarantine vault in the ruins of a plague hospital

mythic_events.name: The Broken Crown
mythic_events.description: A king betrayed his oath and plunged the realm into civil war.

artifact_lore.name: The Ancestors' Blade
artifact_lore.creation_story: Forged in the heart of a dying star by the First Smiths, this blade was tempered in the tears of ancient kings. It was wielded by seven generations of heroes before being lost in the fall of the Last Kingdom.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of rightful leadership and martial prowess. Many noble houses claim descent from its original bearers.
legendary_properties: +3 magical weapon
Deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage to creatures of darkness
Bearer has advantage on Charisma checks when dealing with nobles
Once per day, can rally allies within 30 feet (advantage on saving throws for 1 minute)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Lost in the ruins of a fallen fortress during the Broken Crown civil war

mythic_events.name: The Lost City
mythic_events.description: An entire city vanished under unknown circumstances, leaving myths and ruins.

artifact_lore.name: Horn of the Lost City
artifact_lore.creation_story: The only remaining artifact from a city that vanished in a single night. When blown, some claim to hear echoes of the lost city's final moments.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A haunting reminder of hubris and the fragility of civilization. Scholars study it seeking clues to the city's fate.
legendary_properties: When blown, creates a thunderous sound audible for miles
Once per day, can cast Sending to contact someone in the lost city (may reach the dead)
Reveals illusions and hidden passages within 60 feet when sounded
Bearer has advantage on History checks about lost civilizations
artifact_lore.location_hint: Found in the ruins where the lost city once stood, guarded by restless spirits

mythic_events.name: The Stone Pact
mythic_events.description: Rival tribes sealed a covenant at the Stone Circle and formed lasting alliances.

artifact_lore.name: Ring of the Stone Pact
artifact_lore.creation_story: Forged from the melted weapons of twelve warring tribes who swore peace at the Stone Circle. Each band of the ring bears one tribe's sigil, eternally intertwined.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of diplomacy, alliance, and the power of keeping one's word. Many treaties are still sworn upon this ring's memory.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Zone of Truth once per day
Advantage on Persuasion checks when negotiating peace or treaties
Can understand all spoken languages
When making a promise while wearing the ring, both parties know if the promise is sincere
artifact_lore.location_hint: Kept in the vault of a neutral sanctuary where the original pact was signed

mythic_events.name: The Lost City

artifact_lore.name: Horn of the Lost City

historical_figures.name: Namfoodle Daergel
historical_figures.title: the Noble
achievements: Negotiated the historic accord of The Oath of Twelve
historical_figures.backstory: Namfoodle Daergel the Noble established a dynasty that brought prosperity and justice to the realm. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Thranduil Forestwarden
historical_figures.title: the Cunning
achievements: Misused the knowledge from The First Flame
historical_figures.backstory: Thranduil Forestwarden the Cunning played lords against each other for personal gain, leaving devastation behind. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Ophelia Ravencrest
historical_figures.title: the Bold
achievements: Misused the knowledge from The First Flame
historical_figures.backstory: Ophelia Ravencrest the Bold mastered sorcery that violated natural law, spreading chaos and corruption. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Nimrodel Sunshadow
historical_figures.title: the Dreaded
achievements: Made the pivotal discovery during The First Flame
historical_figures.backstory: Nimrodel Sunshadow the Dreaded achieved victory through clever tactics and diplomatic maneuvering rather than force. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Althea Brightblade
historical_figures.title: the Bold
achievements: Negotiated the historic accord of The Oath of Twelve
historical_figures.backstory: Althea Brightblade the Bold spoke truths that others feared to hear, shaping spiritual understanding. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Daar Kepeshkmolik
historical_figures.title: the Dreaded
achievements: Negotiated the historic accord of The Oath of Twelve
historical_figures.backstory: Daar Kepeshkmolik the Dreaded spoke truths that others feared to hear, shaping spiritual understanding. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Elara Goldwyn
historical_figures.title: the Noble
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Master of political intrigue, Elara Goldwyn the Noble orchestrated alliances that changed history. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Kassandra Goldwyn
historical_figures.title: the Wise
achievements: Caused or worsened The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Wherever Kassandra Goldwyn the Wise traveled, death and decay followed in their wake. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Galadriel Nightbreeze
historical_figures.title: the Terrible
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Blessed with divine insight, Galadriel Nightbreeze the Terrible guided civilization through apocalyptic trials. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Darius Ironheart
historical_figures.title: the Undefeated
achievements: Led forces to victory in The Broken Crown
historical_figures.backstory: Through unparalleled skill and innovation, Darius Ironheart the Undefeated crafted artifacts of immense power. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Thamior Meliamne
historical_figures.title: the Wise
achievements: Brought devastation through The Broken Crown
historical_figures.backstory: Known for cruelty and ambition, Thamior Meliamne the Wise brought entire kingdoms under tyrannical rule. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Greta Gemcutter
historical_figures.title: the Terrible
achievements: Led forces to victory in The Broken Crown
historical_figures.backstory: Master of political intrigue, Greta Gemcutter the Terrible orchestrated alliances that changed history. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Sigrid Gemcutter
historical_figures.title: the Undefeated
achievements: Attempted to prevent The Lost City
historical_figures.backstory: Sigrid Gemcutter the Undefeated established a dynasty that brought prosperity and justice to the realm. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Gareth Whitestone
historical_figures.title: the Dreaded
achievements: Negotiated the historic accord of The Stone Pact
historical_figures.backstory: Gareth Whitestone the Dreaded traveled the lands sharing visions and warnings that would prove prophetic. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Ekemon Soulfire
historical_figures.title: the Terrible
achievements: Negotiated the historic accord of The Stone Pact
historical_figures.backstory: Ekemon Soulfire the Terrible maintained the sacred traditions and taught future generations the old ways. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Cedric Brightblade
historical_figures.title: the Fierce
historical_figures.backstory: Cedric Brightblade the Fierce played lords against each other for personal gain, leaving devastation behind. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

civilizations.name: The Infernal Shadowhaven
civilizations.cultural_description: The Infernal Shadowhaven is a tiefling civilization governed by democratic vote. Their culture is defined by fierce independence and personal liberty, spirit of innovation and progress, hardened by struggle and survival.

territory.territorial_description: The Infernal Shadowhaven controls a expansive territory of 12 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

civilizations.name: Brightwood Enclave
civilizations.cultural_description: Brightwood Enclave is a elf civilization ruled by hereditary monarchs. Their culture is defined by pursuit of knowledge and wisdom, mastery of arcane arts.

territory.territorial_description: Brightwood Enclave controls a substantial territory of 9 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Masters of arcane arts and ancient lore

civilizations.name: The Nexus Coalition
civilizations.cultural_description: The Nexus Coalition is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization ruled by hereditary monarchs. Their culture is defined by fierce independence and personal liberty, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom, spirit of innovation and progress.

territory.territorial_description: The Nexus Coalition controls a modest territory of 6 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Complex legal systems balancing diverse needs
Melting pot of cultures and traditions

civilizations.name: Twilight Haven
civilizations.religious_beliefs: Blend human and elven spiritual traditions
civilizations.cultural_description: Twilight Haven is a half-elf civilization controlled by elite families. Their culture is defined by spirit of innovation and progress, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom, prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth.

territory.territorial_description: Twilight Haven controls a substantial territory of 10 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

civilizations.name: Free Federation
civilizations.cultural_description: Free Federation is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by strict laws and social order, fierce independence and personal liberty, prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth.

territory.territorial_description: Free Federation controls a substantial territory of 10 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Melting pot of cultures and traditions
